title: Modem and RF System Engineer
summary: Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Dynamic, sensible people and inspiring, innovative technologies are the norm here. Join us to help deliver the next groundbreaking Apple product. Do you love working on challenges that no one has solved yet? Are you ready to join a team transforming hardware technology? We are searching for a dedicated engineer with 3+/- years’ experience to join our exciting team of innovators. In this role, you will be a key member of the system engineering team working on modem systems features and requirements.
description:
- Collaborate across RF and modem teams (HW/FW) on AGC development and RF modeling activities.
- AGC algorithm development, modeling and bring-up.
- Develop RF models for link-level simulations, analyze/characterize the results and provide mitigation and optimization guidelines.
key_qualifications:
Deep-knowledge of communication system theory and signal processing.
Knowledge of RF systems, RF impairment modeling and mitigation techniques (phase noise, IQ imbalance, DC offset, etc), digital RF-front design.
Knowledge of cellular communication standards: 5GNR FR1/FR2, 4G LTE, 3G (HSPA), 2G GSM.
Experience with automatic gain control (AGC) for LTE/NR is a plus.
Experience with analog and digital beam forming techniques and MIMO systems.
Fluent in Matlab, and/or C/C++/Python for algorithm development, modeling (floating-point and fixed-point) and link-level simulation.
Strong analytical skills (linear algebra, random processes, detection and estimation, etc.).
Experience in chip bring-up including the use of lab equipment such as protocol test equipment, spectrum. analyzers, signal generators, power meters, etc. a plus.
Hands-on experience in lab testing & characterization is a plus.
Strong teamwork and communication skills.
